There are about 3 bugs in the build/run process of Eclipse and they are interacting with each other making diagnostics tricky.  Lets treat them as one bug entry because otherwise we'll be jumping back and forth between bug entries and getting confused.  Lets just make this a multiple bug thread and track and fix these one at a time. 

Problem#1: I do a make clean in Eclipse.  I do a ./ configure.  I do a build in Eclipse.  It gives an error in the Problems view.  I go outside Eclipse.  I open a console.  I do a make.  It passes without error.  I run the app.  It works.  I go back in Eclipse.  I do a make.  The error disappears.  But the application won't run in Eclipse. 

I suspect this problem is related to the the selection of using the built in Make or the make command from the Textbox on the C/C++ Build properties screen. (See next post for an image.)

a) there seems to be some difference as to what the built in make accomplishes versus what the text box make does.

b) Notice that the Build Options Stop On First Error checkbox doesn't gray out ?

There is a bug in here somewhere.  The builds always work fine from the command line but they are failing in Eclipse for no good reason that I can see. 

I am going to close the other bugs and deal only with this one.
Created an attachment (id=30631)
Build properties. 

*** Bug 117993 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
OK.  Instead of doing a Project Build, which should have invoked "make all", I did a Project->Create Make Target and built a new make target.  Then I did a Project->Build Make Target.  The project built.  It still wouldn't run. 

I went to Run->Run...  I deleted tried reselecting the run object. (/bin/sdcc).  Still wouldn't run.  Then I deleted the run object and put a new one in. When I did this it did a make by itself.  And then it ran.  HUH ?  Why did it do that ?

Now it runs every time. 

So... I think there are 3 bugs here:

1) make gets errors that shouldn't be there.
2) redoing make shows no errors but the app won't run.
3) deleting the existing run object and replacing it with an identical new one will allow the app to run. 

Now, to further compound this, I think this only occurs after doing a make clean followed by a ./configure.  I think if I don't run make clean and ./configure it will work fine all day long.  Except that make is always running when I do a run. 

BTW: The application is the open source compiler sdcc.  
Here is how to replicate what I am seeing:

a) Create a new project in Eclipse from a CVS download with this CVS info

cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/sdcc co sdcc 
The password is empty and pressing [ENTER] will get you in.  

b) convert the project to a standard make project

c) set up an external app for sdcc/configure.  Do a configure.

c) set up the build target.  Do a project build.

d) set up the run target for /bin/sdcc  Run sdcc.

e) do a make clean. Do a configure. Do a make.  Do a run.

You should see a number of errors appear during this process.  

I am running Eclipse with

$eclipse -vargs -Xmx256M &

The computer it runs on has 1GB RAM and 2GB free on the hard drive.
